intro: Tanacetum potentilloides, commonly known as field tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, gray-green leaves and yellow button-like flowers. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Tanacetum potentilloides is known for its aromatic properties and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
